page.title: 06FARM MACHINERY.
page.content: Mr. Randall, the owner of Hyde and Temple Farms, normally spends between Â£70,000 and Â£200,000 on equipment to help him run his farms efficiently. Here is some information about a few of his farm machines. He has a new tractor with an air- conditioned cab, which cost around Â£25,000. Tractors are very useful because of the different attachments which can be put on them to do various tasks such as ploughing and sowing seed. A crop sprayer is used for inse- cticides and fertilisers, as well as watering the crops in dry weather. Mr. Randall's sprayer holds 2400 litres. Combine harvesters cost about Â£40,000, and pasture mowers Â£2,000. Mr.Randall also has machines to churn the hay and mix the silage for the cows, and to distribute feed to them in the cow shed pens.
